text:
I'm a forester
in training and background,

and set up Treemetrics
with a colleague from college.

We set about the vision
about providing

better forest measurement
and tree measurement.

We have everything from satellite
images, to drone images,

to people collecting data
with calipers, your iPhone.
So, it's quite an intense
data management and data store.
We found the Amazon Web Services

as an ideal platform
and mechanism for us to

both develop our technology,
but also to innovate as well.

It allowed us to give us
that flexibility and know-how.

AWS and technology
in general has played a huge role

in our experience
in the forest industry
over the last 20 years.

What we want to do is present
data at an individual tree level

if that needs be, as opposed
to just at a forest level.

The predominant thing
you're looking at

is growth,
but then it may be disease.

It could be fire
damage, storm damage.
You're always going to have

trees being cut down,
trees being replanted.

You're going to have
deforestation with no trees
being replanted.

That's just going
to really revolutionize

how forests are managed
in a really positive way.

That would be
our biggest sustainability.
